result.execSummary:
The defendant Ken-Marlon Valentine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ken-Marlon Valentine in court with attorney John P. Carlson.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.
On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to POSSESSION OF CONTROLLED SUBSTANCE (THC), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(3g)(e), a Misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 3 DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 3 days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 6-2-2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant Ken-Marlon Valentine in court with attorney John P. Carlson.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant is consistently attending treatment and testing negative.  Defendant needs to complete community service.  Review hearing scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ken-Marlon Valentine in court with attorney John P Carlson.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement received and filed.  Court approves the agreement.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and STAYS a judgment of conviction.  Review hearing scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ken-Marlon Valentine in court with attorney John P Carlson.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case set for plea on 6-2-14 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 44.

Defendant Ken-Marlon Valentine in court with attorney John P. Carlson.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case may be resolved with a possible deferred prosecution agreement.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ken-Marlon Valentine in court with attorney John C. Carlson.  William Berens, student intern under the supervsion of Hanna Kolberg for Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Ken-Marlon Valentine in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Ken-Marlon Valentine in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
